Vážená paní poslankyně, nebude to záležet zdaleka jenom na vládě, ale samozřejmě to bude záležet i na této Poslanecké sněmovně. Chtěl bych vás informovat o tom, že vláda na svém jednání 1. července schválila novelu zákona o audiovizi, to je novela zákona č. 496/2012. Tato novela, jak ji vláda schválila - já jsem rád, že se na ní shodla celá vládní koalice a vláda ji schválila jako celek - zásadním způsobem mění podporu českého filmového průmyslu ze strany státu. Nově zavádí systémovou podporu české kinematografie ve formě každoroční pravidelné finanční dotace ze státního rozpočtu. Ta dotace je navržena ve stejné výši, jakou tvoří soukromé zdroje státního fondu kinematografie. To znamená, že hodnota státního příspěvku se bude každý rok vypočítávat na základě audiovizuálních poplatků, které vybere Státní fond kinematografie, a bude to vždycky za dva roky zpětně.

Dá se tedy předpokládat, že by ta dotace ze státního rozpočtu mohla činit někde kolem 180 mil. korun ročně, což by tedy znamenalo navýšení výdajů Státního fondu kinematografie k těm částkám, které on má v tuto chvíli k dispozici, to znamená, že ty výdaje by se mohly pohybovat kolem 390 mil. korun ročně, celkové výdaje fondu kinematografie. Samozřejmě podstatná část těchto prostředků jde na všechny aktivity, které souvisí s podporou českého filmu. Já jsem přesvědčen, že toto rozhodnutí vlády, pokud získá podporu parlamentu a zákon začne platit, bude znamenat výrazný impuls pro podporu české kultury, jejíž klíčovou součástí je česká kinematografie. Myslím si, že se tím přiblížíme vyspělým evropským zemím, protože když jsme připravovali tuto novelu zákona, tak jsme i analyzovali, jak vypadá podpora v jednotlivých státech Evropské unie a ukazuje se, že v těch státech, které zažívaly a zažívají boom v oblasti kinematografie, což jsou zejména skandinávské země, ale i některé další státy ve středu Evropy, jako je třeba Rakousko, tak tyto země mají výrazně vyšší podporu kinematografie z prostředků ať už tedy soukromých nebo státních ve formě subvencí. Stávající forma podpory a stávající úroveň podpory v České republice vůči naší národní kinematografii výrazně zaostávala. Neznamená to snad, že bychom se těmito prostředky dotáhli třeba na úroveň Dánska, ale jsme schopni konkurovat alespoň, řekněme, zemím v bezprostředním okolí, jako je Slovensko, Polsko nebo zčásti Rakousko. Takže dojde k podstatnému systémovému navýšení podpory české kinematografie. My si od toho slibujeme to, že bude podpořeno více nových filmových projektů, že tyto nové filmové projekty budou moci být podpořeny podstatnými částkami, které zjednoduší jejich financování. Samozřejmě státní fond není a ani nemůže být jediným zdrojem financování výroby nových českých filmů, ale pokud se podaří zvýšit poskytované částky a počet podpořených projektů, tak to samozřejmě bude i určitá pobídka a motivace pro soukromé investory v této oblasti.

Poslední věc, kterou bych chtěl zmínit, tak ten ohled vlády, který stál za touto novelou zákona, není veden jenom snahou podpořit český film, ale je veden také snahou podpořit zaměstnanost. Ukazuje se i na základě analýz, které byly zpracovány fondem kinematografie v minulosti, že tato forma podpory umožňuje jednak generovat i privátní investice a jednak pozitivně působí na vytváření a tvorbu nových pracovních míst v oblasti služeb, v oblasti tradičních odvětví, která v České republice byla rozvíjena v minulých letech, protože česká kinematografie je pojem, je pojem už skoro sto let a já si myslím, že je dobře, pokud bude schválen tento návrh zákona, že budeme moci na tu silnou tradici v České republice navázat i v příštích letech. Děkuji.

column6: Madam Vice-President, honorable, Honourable Members, I think this is a pretty big and important topic, because in our country we have tens of thousands of people, it's somewhere around 70 thousand. People who are organized in voluntary fire brigade and the topic of financing their activities is undoubtedly important, because a significant portion of these forces operate as part of the integrated rescue system and directly involved in the aid that is absolutely necessary and I want to especially mention that irreplaceable, because many mayors especially in rural areas, if something really needs to do something real to help citizens and is mostly dependent on voluntary firefighters. Whether it's flooding, whether it is a technical breakdown, whether it is any other security risks, so there are always volunteer firefighters.I am very glad that has acted one thing that we tried a lot here in the Chamber of Deputies in recent years. We encountered a lot of resistance. This time it was to lobby insurance companies that resisted the order to create the fund loss prevention Czech Insurers' Bureau. It eventually succeeded. He managed to push through amendments to the Act and this year is very important because in 2015 for the first time will be shared significant resources that go volunteer firefighters. In total, this year will be 97 miles. Crowns, it's not a small sum, received and 31 municipalities in the new car with a tank. 31 municipalities will receive 2.5 mil. CZK as subsidies and 14 municipalities will receive for the reconstruction of tank cars with 1.5 mil. CZK.If the financial sector is stable and there is no reason to believe that it is not as if similar amounts could be distributed in the coming years.Another important fund that we use to help volunteer firefighters, is an integrated regional operational program in the years 2014 - 2020. The program was approved this year by the European Commission. That means start preparing specific challenges and aims to ensure funds for the firehouse - it would be the first of subsidies - that is, the dislocation new or upgrading existing fire stations.Secondly, we would like to make these funds from the European Union to be able to provide money to increase the basic equipment of the Integrated Rescue System technology and material resources.That means there are options that will render the Integrated Regional Operational Program Ministry of the Interior and here, of course, working together with the Ministry for Regional Development to make it possible to write these challenges and resources to draw upon.The latest plan is the latest initiative of the Ministry of Interior on it to create a new cluster subsidy program, which would have involved the Ministry of Interior, regions and municipalities. This means that these three structures of the public sector would be associated funds and would create a new long-time subsidy title, which would allow finance the needs of the volunteer fire brigade, where failure to obtain European funds. That means it would be a kind of alternative to the spending of European funds. Here, we would be delighted if this were undertaken administrative preparations, we would like to in the negotiations on the state budget for next year was on the budget of the Ministry of Interior earmarked around 200 million. Crowns for the year 2016. That would be the foundation on which the the added resources of regions and municipalities and would create subsidies, which would also be next year, it could finance the restoration of one hand fire stations, partly, of course, to finance recovery techniques.So much for a very brief three basic sources that in the coming years should be jointly and relatively reliable funding needs of the volunteer fire brigade.But I think that this is not just about money. It is of course also about the overall conditions in which our volunteer firefighters with acting. Also we talked about it at their congress, which was now in Pardubice. I can confirm that the Interior Ministry had made progress in the preparation of complex material to the government, which should solve some problems still with the functioning of volunteer firefighters there.

Vážená paní místopředsedkyně, vážené poslankyně, vážení poslanci, já myslím, že tohle je docela velké a důležité téma, protože v naší zemi máme několik desítek tisíc lidí, je to někde kolem 70 tis. lidí, kteří jsou organizováni ve sborech dobrovolných hasičů a téma financování jejich činnosti je nepochybně důležité, protože významná část těchto sborů působí jako součást integrovaného záchranného systému a bezprostředně se podílí na pomoci, která je naprosto nezbytná a chci především zmínit, že nenahraditelná, protože řada starostů zejména na venkově, pokud potřebuje něco reálně udělat, nějak reálně občanům pomoci, tak je většinou odkázána právě na dobrovolné hasiče. Ať už jde o povodně, ať už jde o technické havárie, ať jde o jakákoliv jiná bezpečnostní rizika, tak vždycky jsou tady dobrovolní hasiči.

Já jsem velmi rád, že zafungovala jedna věc, o kterou jsme se tady hodně snažili v této Poslanecké sněmovně v minulých letech. Naráželi jsme na velký odpor. Tentokrát to bylo lobby pojišťoven, které se bránilo tomu, abychom vytvořili fond zábrany škod České kanceláře pojistitelů. To se nakonec povedlo. Podařilo se prosadit novelu zákona a letošní rok je velmi důležitý, protože v roce 2015 poprvé budou rozděleny významné prostředky, které půjdou dobrovolným hasičům. Celkem to letos bude 97 mil. korun, to není zrovna malá částka, a dotaci obdrží 31 obcí na nový vůz s cisternou. 31 obcí dostane po 2,5 mil. Kč jako dotaci a 14 obcí dostane na rekonstrukci auta s cisternou 1,5 mil. Kč.

Pokud ten finanční sektor bude stabilní a nemáme důvod se domnívat že nikoliv, tak by obdobné částky mohly být rozdělovány i v příštích letech.

Dalším důležitým fondem, který chceme využít pro pomoc dobrovolným hasičům, je integrovaný regionální operační program v letech 2014 - 2020. Tento program byl v letošním roce schválen ze strany Evropské komise. To znamená, začínají se připravovat konkrétní výzvy a cílem je, aby byly zajištěny finanční prostředky na hasičské zbrojnice - to by byl první dotační titul - to znamená na nové dislokace nebo modernizaci stávajících hasičských zbrojnic.

Za druhé, rádi bychom, aby z těchto prostředků z Evropské unie bylo možné poskytnout peníze na posílení vybavení základních složek integrovaného záchranného systému technikou a věcnými prostředky.

To znamená, tady jsou možnosti, které bude skýtat integrovaný regionální operační program a i tady Ministerstvo vnitra už samozřejmě pracuje společně s Ministerstvem pro místní rozvoj na tom, aby bylo možné vypsat výzvy a tyto prostředky čerpat.

Poslední nejnovější iniciativou je plán Ministerstva vnitra na to, aby vznikl nový sdružený dotační program, na kterém by se podílelo Ministerstvo vnitra, kraje a obce. To znamená, tyto tři struktury veřejného sektoru by sdružily finanční prostředky a vytvořil by se nový dlouholetý dotační titul, který by umožňoval financovat potřeby sboru dobrovolných hasičů tam, kde se nepodaří získat evropské zdroje. To znamená, byla by to jakási alternativa vůči čerpání evropských zdrojů. Tady bychom byli rádi, kdyby letos byly podniknuty administrativní přípravy, rádi bychom, aby v rámci vyjednávání o státním rozpočtu na příští rok bylo na té úrovni rozpočtu Ministerstva vnitra vyčleněno zhruba 200 mil. korun pro rok 2016. To by byl základ, ke kterému by se přidaly prostředky krajů a obcí a vznikl by dotační titul, který by rovněž v příštím roce už mohl financovat jednak obnovu hasičských zbrojnic, jednak samozřejmě financovat obnovu techniky.

Tolik tedy velmi stručně tři základní zdroje, ze kterých by v příštích letech měly být společně a relativně spolehlivě financovány potřeby sboru dobrovolných hasičů.

Ale myslím si, že tady nejde jenom o peníze. Jde samozřejmě také o celkové podmínky, ve kterých u nás dobrovolní hasiči působí. Také o tom se mluvilo na jejich sjezdu, který byl teď v Pardubicích. Mohu potvrdit, že Ministerstvo vnitra už pokročilo v přípravě komplexního materiálu do vlády, který by měl řešit některé problémy, které ještě s fungováním dobrovolných hasičů existují.

column8:
Vítám dnešní rozhodnutí Ústavního soudu, který odmítl návrh prezidenta republiky na zrušení zákona o státní službě. Soud rozhodl podle mého názoru logicky, v rámci naší platné Ústavy, a zodpovědně. Jsem rád, že tak může pokračovat důležitá reforma, kterou prosadila naše vláda a která po dlouhých letech váhání a odkládání zajistí nestrannost a vyšší kvalitu státní správy, a tedy i lepší fungování státu. Vypuštění věty, která se týká systemizace některých úřadů, respektuji jako ústavně odůvodnitelné. Zrušení této věty myslím nezpůsobí při aplikaci zákona žádné vážnější problémy. Prosazením zákona o státní službě naše koaliční vláda naplnila jeden ze svých klíčových závazků vůči občanům České republiky. Poslední verze zákona, kterou se podařilo v Poslanecké sněmovně prosadit, vyplynula z dohody koaličních partnerů a opozice, a získala širokou podporu napříč politickým spektrem. Tato norma je pro Českou republiku historickým milníkem, který postupně zajistí nejen zkvalitnění státní správy, ale také umožní České republice v následujícím programovacím období čerpat zhruba 600 mld. korun z evropských fondů. Přijetím zákona o státní službě se současně řadíme do společnosti evropských zemí se stabilní státní správou.

Bohuslav Sobotka, předseda vlády ČR

column1: Komentář předsedy vlády k procesu migrace
column6: Within a one-off solidarity actions that take place throughout the EU, the Czech Republic voluntarily adopted in the years 2015 to 2017 a total of 1,500 refugees. The whole process will be under the government's control, especially in terms of safety. Throw a partial redistribution of refugees perceive as our assistance necessary in the current situation, which matches the capabilities of the Czech Republic, not as a solution to the problem, which has Europe today with migration. We stand as a republic that the EU must now primarily to ensure proper functioning of the Schengen border and implementation of policy on return of illegal economic migrants. It is also necessary to aggressively intervene against smuggling networks and to stabilize the country, which are the source of migratory flows, including construction of facilities for asylum seekers outside EU borders.Bohuslav Sobotka, Prime Minister

Celý proces bude mít vláda pod svou kontrolou, a to zejména z bezpečnostního hlediska. Jednorázové částečné přerozdělení uprchlíků vnímám jako naši nezbytnou pomoc v současné krizové situaci, která odpovídá možnostem České republiky, nikoliv jako řešení problému, který má dnes Evropa s migrací. Trváme jako republika na tom, že EU se musí nyní primárně věnovat zajištění řádného fungování schengenské hranice a realizaci návratové politiky u nelegálních ekonomických migrantů. Je také nutno razantně zasáhnout proti pašeráckým sítím a stabilizovat země, které jsou zdrojem migračních vln včetně vybudování zařízení pro žadatele o azyl mimo hranice EU.

Bohuslav Sobotka, předseda vlády ČR

column1: Nenechám se šibenicemi zastrašit
column6: Democracy must be able to defend the principles for which it stands. When we fail, we can come to an end as the Weimar Republic. Police and public prosecutors must strictly ensure compliance.I will not be intimidated by attacks from a gallows. I will continue to act in accordance with their conscience and values ​​of social democracy. I am convinced that the process of government in migration crisis is correct and the only possible.We rejected a really bad idea to quotas and help on a voluntary basis, at its discretion, within our real security and economic opportunities. Our country can not stick your head in the sand, close borders and pretend that the problem with us the rest of Europe no concern.I am convinced that our economic and security capacities allow us to take care of several hundred refugees and maintain the human and solidarity towards the countries in the EU, which are exposed not hundreds, but tens of thousands of migrants.The government has the situation under control, and people really do not have anything bad to worry about. At the same time, we will insist that Europe needs to better patrol its borders, return of economic migrants and to concentrate more on the stabilization of the countries in our immediate vicinity.I consider absurd and strange situation that affects police against demonstrators who blocked the path of the procession with strong zfanatizovanému gallows in hand without being in any way interested in precisely these gallows and what is associated with them.Much worse, however, the behavior of politicians, who fear the people of the migration of Muslims and inciting hatred towards refugees trying to gain political points or rebuild their recent collapse of political positions.But it's not just a case of the Czech Republic, a migratory crisis infuses new blood into the veins of various extremists and fascists across Europe. Democrats are against it must clearly stand. I believe that the issue of managing migration and voluntary assistance to refugees in our country will be a coalition government act together and send it to our citizens a clear signal that we are a country that is being realistic and at the same time so as to assist where possible.I think that populists throughout our continent are tempted to fear from migration morphed into ammunition for winning political power. Usually they do not resist. It's so simple. People are naturally terrified of rampaging Islamic state and also pictures from Italy, Hungary and Greece.Genie out of the bottle, that all this demagoguery launches, however, will push back hard.The migration issue is complex and, in fact, has a simple and quick solution. Europe suffers from the fact that it has a stronger common foreign and security policy, to respond faster and more aggressively in regions that are destabilizing. This one, no country can face it alone, we need a strong common policy. The journey is not isolation but cooperation.Bohuslav Sobotka, novinky.cz, July 2, 2015

column8:
Demokracie musí být schopna uhájit principy, na kterých stojí. Když se nám to nepovede, můžeme jednou skončit jako Výmarská republika. Policie a státní zastupitelství musí striktně dbát na dodržování zákonů.

Nenechám se útoky s šibenicemi zastrašit. Budu i nadále postupovat v souladu se svým svědomím a hodnotami sociální demokracie. Jsem přesvědčen o tom, že postup vlády v oblasti migrační krize je správný a jediný možný.

Odmítli jsme opravdu špatný nápad s kvótami a pomůžeme na dobrovolné bázi, na základě vlastního rozhodnutí, v rámci našich reálných bezpečnostních a ekonomických možností. Naše země nemůže strčit hlavu do písku, zavřít hranice a tvářit se, že se nás problém zbytku Evropy vůbec netýká.

Jsem přesvědčen o tom, že naše ekonomické a bezpečnostní kapacity nám umožňují postarat se o několik stovek uprchlíků a zachovat se lidsky a také solidárně vůči zemím v EU, které jsou vystaveny ne stovkám, ale desítkám tisíc migrantů.

Vláda má situaci pod kontrolou a lidé se skutečně nemusejí ničeho zlého obávat. Současně budeme trvat na tom, aby Evropa začala lépe hlídat své hranice, vracet ekonomické migranty a více se soustředit na stabilizaci zemí v našem bezprostředním okolí.

Pokládám za absurdní a zvláštní situaci, že policie zasahuje vůči demonstrantům, kteří blokují cestu silně zfanatizovanému průvodu s šibenicemi v rukou, aniž by ji jakkoliv zajímaly právě tyto šibenice a to, co je s nimi spojeno.

Mnohem horší je ale chování politiků, kteří se na strachu lidí z migrace a muslimů a na vyvolávání nenávisti vůči uprchlíkům snaží získat politické body či znovu vybudovat své nedávno zhroucené politické pozice.

Ale to není jen případ České republiky, migrační krize vlévá novou krev do žil nejrůznějším extremistům a fašistům po celé Evropě. Demokraté se proti tomu musí jednoznačně postavit. Věřím, že i v otázce zvládání migrace a dobrovolné pomoci naší země uprchlíkům bude celá vládní koalice postupovat jednotně a vyšle tím i našim občanům jasný signál že jsme zemí, která postupuje realisticky a současně tak, aby pomáhala tam, kde to je možné.

Myslím, že populisté na celém našem kontinentu jsou ve velkém pokušení, aby strach z migrace přetavili do munice pro získání politické moci. Většinou tomu neodolají. Je to tak jednoduché. Lidé jsou přirozeně vyděšení z řádění Islámského státu a taky obrázky z Itálie, Maďarska či Řecka.

Džiny z láhve, které všechna tahle demagogie vypustí, bude ovšem těžké zatlačit zpátky.

Problém migrace je komplexní a ve skutečnosti nemá jednoduché a rychlé řešení. Evropa doplácí na to, že nemá silnější společnou zahraniční a bezpečnostní politiku, aby mohla reagovat rychleji a razantněji v regionech, které se destabilizují. Tomuhle nemůže žádná země čelit sama, potřebujeme silnější společnou politiku. Cesta tedy není izolace, ale spolupráce.

Bohuslav Sobotka,

novinky.cz

, 2. července 2015

column1: Předseda vlády se zúčastnil slavnostního zasedání u příležitosti 600. výročí upálení Mistra Jana Husa
column6: Prime Minister Bohuslav Sobotka in his speech on this occasion the importance of Jan Hus as a man who was not afraid to defy the rules of power, and as a church reformer, who in his time one hundred years has overtaken the European Reformation.Dear Chancellor, Mr Dean, Dear government officials, distinguished academics, ladies and gentlemen, Jan Hus is one of the most important figures in our history. For our national revival, the first Czechoslovak president Tomas Garrigue Masaryk and the First Republic, Hus became a figure who symbolized the moral autonomy as our national and democratic program. The Husův ideal of living in truth also followed up resistance movement during World War II, reformist tendencies of civil society during the Prague Spring of 1968. The Husa followed up sacrifice of Jan Palach and Jan Zajic and finally Velvet Revolution in 1989.600th anniversary of the burning of Jan Hus is not only the commemoration of the life and tragic death of one visible figures in our history, but also a reminder of the deeper meaning of our political efforts. Jan Hus is a symbolic figure for us: we see him as a man who stood for the knowledge of the truth and was not afraid to stand up to those who wanted out of positions of power to determine what is true. That is why the people Hus clamped turning points in our history, in which decisions are taken as to whether they themselves determine the shape of their national political and cultural life, or whether it will be determined by the appearance from the outside, some outside power. Hus at the time after his death became a symbol of their own conscience. In response to his violent death was born in Bohemia Hussite movement which Huss ability to stand up to authority and powerful persevere in their truth appropriated. This movement then was so strong that in many respects a long time or even permanently changed our country and society.Jan Hus was a reformer of the Church, which is essentially a hundred years outperformed German and European Reformation. When the German reformer Martin Luther hundred years after the death of Huss met with the teaching of Czech champion, he said in a circle of his followers: "Without it, we know we are all Hussites". Czech Hussite movement and the European Reformation case can be seen as part of the democratization movement then the late Middle Ages.Jan Hus was well on his time immensely popular preacher and was also a university champion. In his preaching he was a good life for people, to make lapsing in your life to evil. It was therefore sought to remedy the Church, which had spiritual and moral life of the people to manage. Dissolute and profligate life of priests saw as an obstacle to salvation. This concept Hus Church and Church authority, however, was a thorn in his opponents at the Council of Constance. Conflict with those who represented the official voice of the former church, it eventually cost the life of Jan Hus.In his tenure at Charles University, on whose land we are now, Huss was the freedom of learning. Therefore, he opposed the decree, ordered to burn the books of John Wycliffe. Now the fight for the opportunity to study the writings of Wycliffe and teach his reform ideas was behind the famous Kutna Hora decree, which changed the proportion of votes among university nations.  Huss efforts on campus have a universal dimension to the contrary - pointing to reform the whole Church, which had an international and universal character.Jan Hus was a personality that our society in the past strongly divided. Today, it is not. He became for us was truly national figure. The ideals of freedom of education, freedom of conscience, resistance against dishonesty and wrongfully exercised power with whom you associate Husa today, the shared ideals of Czech society and have firm roots beyond the borders of our country, in today's democratic Europe.Tomas Garrigue Masaryk began precisely at Goose and husitství line sense of Czech history, which, according to his humanity. Hus's legacy is a challenge for independent and critical thinking, to live in conformity with their own convictions, the adjustment efforts of public affairs. It is a challenge to what today we might call worry about a good society, a society that is fair and free, which is a democratic society in which people are equal and self-managed their stuff. In pursuit of it all, making this ideal fulfilled even today, Husův link even after 600 years since his tragic death still current.Thank you.

column8:
Předseda vlády Bohuslav Sobotka ve svém projevu při této příležitosti připomněl význam Mistra Jana Husa jako člověka, který se nebál vzepřít mocenským pravidlům, a zároveň jako církevního reformátora, který ve své době o sto let předstihl evropskou reformaci.

Vážený pane rektore, vážený pane děkane, vážení ústavní činitelé, vážení představitelé akademické obce, dámy a pánové, 

Mistr Jan Hus patří k nejvýznamnějším postavám našich dějin. Pro naše národní obrození, pro prvního československého prezidenta Tomáše Garrigua Masaryka a pro první republiku se Hus stal postavou, která symbolizovala mravní autonomii jako náš národní a demokratický program. Na Husův ideál života v pravdě navazovalo také odbojové hnutí za druhé světové války, reformní tendence občanské společnosti v období Pražského jara roku 1968. Na Husa navazovaly oběti Jana Palacha i Jana Zajíce a nakonec i Sametová revoluce v roce 1989.

600. výročí upálení Mistra Jana Husa je tedy nejen připomínkou života a tragické smrti jedné viditelné postavy našich dějin, nýbrž i připomínkou hlubšího smyslu našich politických snah. Jan Hus je pro nás postavou symbolickou: vnímáme jej jako člověka, který stál za poznanou pravdou a nebál se vzepřít těm, kteří chtěli z mocenských pozic určovat, co pravda je. Právě proto se k Husovi upínají lidé ve zlomových okamžicích našich dějin, v nichž se rozhoduje mezi tím, zda budou sami určovat podobu svého národního politického a kulturního života, nebo zda bude tato podoba určována z vnějšku, nějakou vnější mocí. Hus se v okamžiku po své smrti stal symbolem vlastnímu svědomí. V reakci na jeho násilnou smrt se v Čechách zrodilo husitské hnutí, které si Husovu schopnost postavit se autoritě mocných a vytrvat ve své pravdě přisvojilo. Toto hnutí pak bylo natolik silné, že v řadě ohledů nadlouho či dokonce natrvalo proměnilo naši zemi a společnost.

Jan Hus byl církevním reformátorem, který v podstatě o sto let předstihl německou a evropskou reformaci. Když se německý reformátor Martin Luther sto let po Husově smrti seznámil s učením českého mistra, prohlásil v kruhu svých stoupenců: „Aniž jsme to věděli, všichni jsme husité“. České husitství i evropskou reformaci přitom můžeme vnímat jako součást demokratizačního pohybu tehdejšího pozdního středověku.

Jan Hus byl ale také na svoji dobu nesmírně populárním kazatelem a byl také univerzitním mistrem. V jeho kazatelské činnosti mu šlo o dobrý život lidí, o to, aby nepropadali ve svém životě zlu. Právě proto usiloval o nápravu církve, která tehdy duchovní a morální život lidí spravovala. Nemravný a rozhazovačný život kněží viděl jako překážku spásy. Toto Husovo pojetí církve a církevního úřadu bylo ovšem trnem v oku jeho protivníků na kostnickém koncilu. Konflikt s těmi, kteří reprezentovali oficiální hlas tehdejší církve, jej nakonec stál Jana Husa život.

V jeho působení na Karlově univerzitě, na jejíž půdě se právě nacházíme, šlo Husovi o svobodu učení. Proto se postavil proti výnosu, který přikazoval spálit knihy Jana Viklefa. Právě boj za možnost studovat Viklefovy spisy a vyučovat jeho reformní myšlenky byl v pozadí známého kutnohorského dekretu, kterým se měnil poměr hlasů mezi univerzitními národy.  

Husovy snahy na akademické půdě měly naopak univerzální rozměr – směřovaly k reformě celé církve, která měla mezinárodní a univerzální charakter.

Jan Hus byl osobností, která naši společnost v minulosti výrazně rozdělovala. Dnes už tomu tak není. Stal se pro nás postupně postavou skutečně národní. Ideály svobody vzdělání, svobody svědomí, odporu proti nepoctivosti a nespravedlivě vykonávané moci, s nimiž si Husa dodnes spojujeme, jsou sdílenými ideály české společnosti a mají své pevné kořeny za hranicemi naší země, v dnešní demokratické Evropě.

Tomáš Garrigue Masaryk započal právě u Husa a husitství linii smyslu českých dějin, kterým je podle něj humanita. Husův odkaz je výzvou k samostatnému a kritickému myšlení, k životu ve shodě s vlastním přesvědčením, k úsilí o nápravu věcí veřejných. Je to výzva k tomu, co dnes můžeme nazvat starostí o dobrou společnost, společnost, která je spravedlivá, svobodná a která je demokratická, společnost, v níž jsou si lidé rovni a sami spravují své věci. Ve snaze o to vše, aby byl tento ideál naplněn i dnes, je Husův odkaz i po 600 letech od jeho tragické smrti stále aktuální.

Děkuji.

column1: Vyjádření předsedy vlády k úmrtí sira Nicholase Wintona
column6: The report on the death of Sir Nicholas Winton, who on the eve of World War II saved 669 Czechoslovak children from Nazi persecution and almost certain death in the Czech Republic must intervene absolutely everyone. Nor is it a very high number of children saved, what makes his feat so extraordinary, but dedication and compassion with which a seemingly hopeless situation and frightening time embarked on the rescue of others, in addition to the country that was actually a stranger. Nicholas Winton is for me a real role model of humanity, modesty and immense civil courage.Bohuslav Sobotka, Prime Minister

column1: Premiér Sobotka se zúčastnil oslav 20. výročí Rádia Svobodná Evropa
column6: Ladies and Gentlemen,Have a nice evening. Right here, in this hall, they were written Czech and Slovak history. Wrote here in bad times and wrote here also in better times. Exactly twenty years ago, as has been said here, this building became a symbol of Czech-US relations, and it begins streaming, Radio Free Europe / Radio Liberty from this place.During my student years before 1989, I like a lot of people in the former Czechoslovakia listened to Radio Free Europe. It was an important alternative source of information. Then for me it was very difficult to imagine that one day I and my country will be part of the democratic West. Then came the Velvet Revolution and a major collapse of the communist regime. It was necessary to learn to recognize and overcome the multiple difficulties, to build a democratic state. Everything we had at breakneck experience and absorb.  But the days of 1994, days moving Radio Free Europe from Munich to Prague, I remember today. After four and a half years of the nascent Czech democracy has not been transmitted to us in the East, but from us Westerners! Symbolic was the first headquarters of Radio Free Europe right here in the building of the former Czechoslovak Federal Parliament.In this context I would like to highlight two important personalities of the history of Radio Free Europe / Radio Liberty, and Mr. Paul and Mr. Pecháček Kevin Klose. Let me inform you that I have decided as Prime Minister of the Czech Republic to appreciate their lifelong work for democracy, freedom, human rights and a significant share of changes and development of our country, awarding medals Karel Kramar.Ladies and Gentlemen,„The best propaganda is true"- These are the words of Paul Pecháček whose life story is linked with Radio Free Europe. It is for us a symbol of untiring active help our country from exile in Germany and the United States. It was he who during the November 89 broadcast reportage Czech directly from Wenceslas Square, then still at a time when the former regime blocked the news media. In exile after sixty-eight began at Radio Free Europe, then from 1975 he served as director of the Czechoslovak section of Voice of America in Washington, and then in 1989 to 2001, again in Munich and Prague as the director of Radio Free Europe. Subsequently, he participated in the transformation of the station into the Czech Radio 6 Right now celebrating an important anniversary, he is 75 years old. Sincerely want him at this moment, certainly for all of you, say hello to Washington and to wish him for the years to good health.In addition to Mr. Pecháček I would also like to thank Kevin Klos, who, along with Vaclav Havel contributed significantly to the idea of ​​shifting Radio Free Europe from Munich to Prague and this idea as president of the radio in the years 1994-1997 fulfilled. He started as editor of the Washington Post. During 25 years in the newspaper, he also experienced the Brezhnev era in Moscow as a correspondent. After ten years he has led major US public service broadcaster. Free Europe then conducted in the years 2012 to 2014. Today he passes on his experience to young journalists as a university professor.Ladies and Gentlemen,Finally, I would like to thank Radio Free Europe / Radio Liberty - and not just for the last 20 years - for the tremendous work for irreplaceable help in difficult times of oppression, a fixed point of objectivity in the universe of disinformation, as the orientation for a large number of students and the voice of freedom.I would wish, no radio, but his listeners that there could be as much as possible and that the words of Free Europe and spread freedom in all the areas that are now experiencing oppression and injustice. And especially to all those present listeners of Radio Free Europe also had a chance to become part of the free world as it was 20 or more years ago has become our country.Thank you.Bohuslav Sobotka, Prime Minister

column8:
Vážené dámy, vážení pánové,

přeji hezký podvečer. Přímo tady, v tomto sále, se psaly české a slovenské dějiny. Psaly se tady v časech špatných a psaly se tady také v časech lepších. Přesně před dvaceti lety, jak už tady zaznělo, se stala tato budova také symbolem vztahů česko-amerických, a to zahájením vysílání Rádia Svobodná Evropa/Rádia Svoboda, právě z tohoto místa.

V době mých studentských let před rokem 1989 jsem jako řada lidí v tehdejším Československu Svobodnou Evropu poslouchal. Byla důležitým alternativním zdrojem informací. Tehdy pro mne bylo velmi obtížné si představit, že jednou já i moje země budeme součástí demokratického Západu. Potom přišla Sametová revoluce a zásadní kolaps komunistického režimu. Bylo nutné se učit, poznávat a překonat mnohočetné nesnáze, budovat demokratický stát. Všechno jsme museli v překotném tempu zažít a absorbovat.  

Ale dny roku 1994, dny přestěhování rozhlasu Svobodné Evropy z Mnichova do Prahy, si vybavuji ještě dnes. Po čtyřech a půl letech rodící se české demokracie se už nemělo vysílat k nám na Východ, ale od nás ze Západu! Symbolické bylo i první sídlo Svobodné Evropy právě tady v budově bývalého československého federálního parlamentu.

V této souvislosti bych chtěl vyzdvihnout dvě významné osobnosti historie Rádia Svobodná Evropa/Rádia Svoboda, a to pana Pavla Pecháčka a pana Kevina Klose. Dovolte mi, abych vás informoval o tom, že jsem se rozhodl jako předseda vlády České republiky ocenit jejich celoživotní práci pro demokracii, svobodu, lidská práva a významný podíl na změnách a rozvoji naší země, a to udělením medaile Karla Kramáře.

Vážené dámy, vážení pánové,

„

Nejlepší propaganda je pravda

“ – to jsou slova Pavla Pecháčka, jehož životní příběh je se Svobodnou Evropou spjatý. Je pro nás symbolem neúnavné aktivní pomoci naší zemi z exilu v Německu a ve Spojených státech. Byl to on, kdo během Listopadu 89 vysílal česky reportáže přímo z Václavského náměstí, tehdy ještě v době, kdy minulý režim blokoval sdělovací prostředky. V emigraci po osmašedesátém začínal ve Svobodné Evropě a poté od roku 1975 působil jako ředitel československé sekce Hlasu Ameriky ve Washingtonu, a pak v letech 1989 až 2001 znovu v Mnichově a v Praze jako ředitel Svobodné Evropy. Následně se podílel na transformaci stanice do Českého rozhlasu 6. Právě teď slaví významné životní jubileum, je mu 75 let. Srdečně ho chci v tuto chvíli, jistě i za vás za všechny, pozdravit do Washingtonu a popřát mu do dalších let pevné zdraví.

Kromě pana Pecháčka bych chtěl také poděkovat panu Kevinu Klosovi, který se společně s Václavem Havlem významně podílel na myšlence přesunu Rádia Svobodná Evropa z Mnichova do Prahy a také tuto ideu jako prezident rádia v letech 1994 až 1997 naplnil. Začínal jako editor Washington Post. Během 25 let v tomto deníku zažil i Brežněvovu éru v Moskvě jako zpravodaj. Poté vedl deset let nejvýznamnější americkou veřejnoprávní stanici. Svobodnou Evropu pak řídil i v letech 2012 až 2014. Dnes předává své zkušenosti mladým žurnalistům jako univerzitní profesor.

Vážené dámy, vážení pánové,

na závěr bych chtěl poděkovat Rádiu Svobodná Evropa/Rádiu Svoboda – a to nejen za těch posledních 20 let – za obrovský kus práce, za nenahraditelnou pomoc v těžkých dobách nesvobody, za pevný bod objektivity ve vesmíru dezinformací, za orientaci pro velké množství posluchačů a za šíření hlasu svobody.

Chtěl bych popřát, ne rádiu, ale jeho posluchačům, aby jich mohlo být co nejvíce a aby slova Svobodné Evropy a svobody šířila ve všech oblastech, které dnes zažívají útlak a bezpráví. A hlavně, aby se všichni ti dnešní posluchači Svobodné Evropy také měli šanci stát součástí svobodného světa, jako se před 20 a více lety stala i naše země.

Děkuji.

Bohuslav Sobotka, předseda vlády ČR

column1: Kondolence předsedy vlády ČR k úmrtí Josefa Masopusta
column6: With great regret that I received the news of the death of legendary football figures in the Czech Josef Masopust. I wish to express condolences to the family and closest friends of this famous athlete, who wrote in football history, among others gain the Golden Ball for the best European footballer of the year 1962. Josef Masopust will forever remain one of the best Czech soccer players and also a role model for many current and future athletes.  Bohuslav Sobotka, Prime Minister

column6: At the request of the Bavarian party has today decided by mutual agreement to postpone an official visit to Bavaria, which was to take place on 29 to 30 June 2015. The reason for the postponement of the visit is urgent meeting of the Presidents of German political parties on the current situation related to the solution of the crisis in Greece, which convened German Chancellor Angela Merkel on Monday afternoon. Due to the tense situation around Greece this request Bavarian side fully understand. For the visit in Bavaria, we now seek a new term, possibly later this year.Bohuslav Sobotka, Prime Minister

And I fear that if Europe chooses a bad deal, still to get, then I as part of the quota consider wrong solution, so I am afraid that it will only living water. Live Water for extremists, xenophobes for living water, for boundary currents, which ultimately may intensify to the extent that it even spread of Europe, preventing any meaningful continuation of further European integration. That I think is a big problem.Naturally internal consequences are manifested by the fact that in the second, third generation immigrants from Muslim backgrounds in the Arab world leads to their radicalization.And as a result of ideological contact with an Islamic state. Descendants of immigrants in the second and third generation leaves to fight in Iraq, leaves to fight in Syria. Many of them will return to Europe. We experienced assassinations in Paris, which is what is happening, increasing tensions within Europe, not only political, but also security tensions. Before he arrived migration wave, and just remind fears of terrorism, which had spread especially after the brutal assassination in Paris. So all this is a matter which significantly complicates the situation in Europe. To complement the picture, so I think it should also be added the very objectively disturbed relations between Europe and Russia, which have occurred as a result of the crisis in Ukraine. And just remind you that cooperation with Russia should be in the Middle East or North Africa may be in many respects very important. This cooperation was a result of the crisis in Ukraine disrupted and that of course may also mean some limitations to our room for maneuver.As I mentioned, I do not think this situation can be underestimated. I do not think it's just a matter of the next few months, that's too much, and in a few months there will be another topic. I think it is a matter of a few years, perhaps even a number of years. I think it will change Europe, it will change the European policy and is now up to us as the Czech Republic worked toward, which we believe will help Europe.Let me therefore commenting in detail on the situation, to try to respond to some comments that there had previously been made within the performances of the clubs have convened this meeting. And I will start with what is actually happening.The most important, and now we talk about migration, migrants to European Union countries facing several strong currents. The most important is the central Mediterranean route. Then the western Balkan route and the Eastern Mediterranean route. In 2014 the central Mediterranean route benefited 170,000 refugees, which accounted for an increase of 270% compared to 2013. For the first five months of this year reached the Italian border 47 000 refugees. These were mainly people from Eritrea, Somalia and other inhabitants of sub-Saharan Africa. Regarding the Western Balkans route, it was channeled into the European Union of 37 000 refugees, which meant an almost 90% increase over 2013. Just this year crossed the border in the region over 50,000 migrants, mostly people from Kosovo, Afghans and Syrians. Of this route is currently becoming a major migratory flow.Regarding the Eastern Mediterranean route, it recorded in 2014 over 50,000 illegal border crossing. Just this year, but the way he passed the 47,000 refugees, mainly of people from Syria and Afghanistan. These statistics particularly the rapidly growing trend is alarming and of course can not leave Europe just passively further development.As is evident from the spectrum of nationalities that most often lead to Europe, as the main cause of listed migratory flows to be labeled with a number of conflicts that are taking place in our neighborhood. Today, when we talk about refugees, we are talking about migration. I think we are talking mainly about the consequences. And we often forget what it was at the beginning. The situation in North Africa and the Middle East has become very confusing and complicated. For most of us it is very tough to navigate and learn the roots of the political, security and humanitarian tragedy. Therefore,, Honourable Members, first let little tour of what led to the destabilization of this part of the world, because I think that without the knowledge of the causes of consequences can solve very difficult.On 17 December 2010, in Tunisia burned himself as a young street vendor, whose desperate act of protest against bullying police and government offices. Awakened by long-suppressed frustrations of his fellow citizens, high unemployment, corruption, poor living conditions maneuvered into the streets hundreds of thousands of Tunisians who withdraw their pressure forced the local longtime president Ben Ali. Then the protests in Tunisia have launched a wave of social and political unrest, which gradually spilled over into Egypt, spilled over into Libya, Syria and other Arab countries. The Arab Spring had affected a large part of the areas that today are the source of this emigration. And the Arab Spring also hit the world largely unprepared. Although there were predictions that the most authoritarian regimes in the region for a long time acted sooner or later fall, there was no strategy, and it should not, in my opinion, and should neither Europe nor the United States it, based on which we can act effectively. While Tunisia demonstrations brought free elections and the formation of a democratic government, and in other countries, progress has been and even now is not optimistic. In Libya conflict opposition and Gaddafi's dictatorial regime resulted in a bloody battle in which thousands of people died. I remind you that in March 2011, a coalition of the United States, France and Britain intervened against prorežimním forces to facilitate the victory of the local opposition. But the victory of the opposition in Libya has not led to the fact that Libya is on the path to stabilization and democratization. Libya today is plagued by civil war, there are several warring factions, there is dual power, the state apparatus disintegrated, disrupting essential functions of the state. The international community is trying to negotiate a ceasefire, trying to organize talks, but so far they unfortunately did not lead to any real result.Even more complicated and tragic situation in Syria. There were four years ago, a peaceful anti-regime protests President Bashir harshly suppressed. It led to armed rebellion. From Iraq to Syria moved a jihadist militant group, which began to fight not only against the Assad regime but also against the part of the Syrian opposition. So today we have a civil war in Syria several warring groups.Look at Iraq. The Islamic State took over a third of Syrian territory and occupied a substantial portion of Iraq. Out of Iraq in 2011 left the US military and the country's transition to democracy also largely failed. Foundered on the hostility of the various religious sects. Founded group Islamic State, which in June 2014, quickly took over large parts of western and northern Iraq. Today, when you look at Iraq, so Iraq tends to decay than anything else.This is a very brief and cursory description of what happened in previous years, to the south and southeast of the Schengen borders of the European Union. I think that after what had happened, no one can be surprised that there is this serious situation and that more and more people are trying to get out of this region to places that are more stable.The European Union and the Czech Republic, as I mentioned, in recent years become a party. We have tried to contribute to the stabilization of the region. We provided humanitarian assistance, we provide development assistance, but of course those investments which were made either by the US or other countries, so far have not led to a positive outcome.Regarding the procedure of the European Union. In response to the tragic events in the Mediterranean, which were related to the fact that the initial strong migration flow, which was directed from Africa to Europe and was linked to transports by sea, which were carried on ships, which often were not able to fine arrive to Italian shores, there was a whole series of tragedies that have claimed a large number of human lives.In response to these tragic events in the Mediterranean Sea on April 23 this year, held in Brussels extraordinary European Council meeting and I think that's extraordinary European Council meeting in principle surrounds period when migration is a fundamental and crucial issue in terms of the functioning of the European Union.The aim of the European Council meeting in April was to find an effective answer Union and the Member States to the current immigration crisis. Heads of State and Government had adopted a joint statement endorsing specific actions in four areas.The first area is saving lives at sea, particularly by strengthening operations Triton and Poseidon and the expansion of search and rescue operations under the mandate of Frontex.Secondly, the aim was to fight against traffickers and against criminal aspects of the migration, where the European Council decided on a plan concretize efforts leading to the identification and destruction of vessels smugglers use.Thirdly, as the target was defined prevention of illegal migration flows is key in cooperation with third countries.Fourth, strengthen solidarity and responsibility within the European Union.European Council under the last-mentioned Member States have committed to more effective coordination with emergency resettlement relocation, but on a purely voluntary basis, without any quantification. Czech Republic had welcomed the convening of an extraordinary meeting of the European Council supported the adoption of a joint statement with the fact that at this meeting, I as the Prime Minister of the Czech Republic emphasized the Czech Republic's interest in maintaining the principle of voluntariness in receiving refugees.On the current situation, the European Commission also responded. The European Commission on May 13 published a communication entitled 'A European program for migration. In it unveiled its vision for the further functioning of the migration policies of the European Union, it represents an immediate solution to the situation and strategic approach to migration. Program, the Commission adopted on May 27, it submitted a proposal to launch an emergency relokačního system according to article 78 par. 3 of the Treaty on the Functioning of the European Union. Should be relocated 24,000 asylum seekers from Italy and 16 thousand asylum seekers from Greece. In both cases, it should be a citizen of Syria and Eritrea. The Czech Republic should, under this proposal the European Commission accounted for 3.32% of the total relocation, ie. 797 people from Italy, respectively. 531 people from Greece. Total would Czech Republic on the basis of a proposal from the European Commission should take 1,328 people relocated.That same day, also published by the European Commission and a recommendation for a mechanism to resettle 20,000 refugees in Member States of the European Union, which the Czech Republic accounts for 525 people. Both mechanisms proposed by the European Commission, based on the redistribution key that is created on a pro rata basis of the following criteria: 40% make up the bulk of the population, make up 40% of gross domestic product, the number of applications for asylum or resettlement of persons per million population in 2010-2014 They make up 10% and an unemployment rate of 10% this criterion.While resettlement mechanism is in draft form commission recommendations is voluntary for relocation in the event of their establishment should be a compulsory scheme with the involvement of all EU member states, including the Czech Republic.I am convinced that this proposal, which I have just described, the European Commission does not respect the conclusions of the extraordinary European Council meeting in April, because at this meeting, member states agreed on a voluntary redistribution mechanisms. Such action by the European Commission, the Czech Republic is unacceptable and may also represent a dangerous precedent for the future. It is a question of why the European Council should meet at the level of democratically elected representatives of member countries and adopt conclusions if they do not respect the conclusions of the European Commission. I note that the European Commission's mandate is derived from both the European Council and the European Parliament. The European Commission should therefore respect the conclusions of the European Council. The fact that there is so much differentiation, the Czech Republic is an unacceptable action by the European Commission.Dear Members of Parliament, Honourable Members, the Czech government on migration issues intensively. Regarding the much-discussed proposal of the commission, therefore redistribution mechanisms, the position of the government of the Czech Republic clear. We reject the quota system for the redistribution of migrants and the mandatory involvement of member countries to the schemes proposed by the European Commission. We insist that it must be national governments that should have the chance to control migration flows to their countries, and regulate with regard to economic, social and security situation. Uncontrolled migratory flows, if they continue, may break any state mechanism and any social system. Opinion of our government is that the proposed European program to relocate the Czech Republic involved only in the event that it will be a voluntary scheme. Otherwise, the Czech Republic is not the European Commission's proposal to support.Dear Members of Parliament, Honourable Members, at the same time we must realize that in the face of a humanitarian crisis and immigration are not enough simply that we rejected this proposal from the European Commission. To support its position, thus maintaining a voluntary mechanisms, at the European Council next week prepared to discuss options for strengthening solidarity activities Czech Republic. We will be ready in negotiations declare their willingness, but with that, and I emphasize that, independently and voluntarily outside the proposed program. Regarding the specific form of bilateral cooperation with Italy, with Greece or Germany or Austria, it must be a matter of our national decision. Such an approach is in line with the established position of the Czech Republic. We strive to act in solidarity in the long term and mitigate the effects of migration crisis. We received in recent years a series of measures targeting the effective promotion and development of third countries which are the source and transit countries of migration. Their purpose is stabilization and development. In January this year, our government has approved a program to help refugees in regions of origin, which will be released one hundred million crowns annually. 2015 is predominantly a priority region of the Middle East in the context of the humanitarian crisis in Syria. We expect that this project will be updated annually, as the situation develops will also be possible to modify the amount that the stabilization in these regions provide.I also want to remind you that the Czech Republic is involved in joint European development programs and protection in third countries. In 2014, we were involved in implementing the program for the Middle East in Jordan and in Lebanon and in Iraq. We gave absolutely concrete financial contributions, and this year will also get involved in the program for North Africa. Since 2008 the Czech Republic also participates in the voluntary resettlement activities through the concept of national resettlement program. I want to remind you that in 2015 we opted for the voluntary resettlement of 15 Syrian families are wounded or sick children in Jordan. In total it will be 70 people.Among our solidarity activities include government scholarship program for 20 Syrian refugees in Jordan on Czech public universities. I want to remind ongoing humanitarian assistance to refugees and internally displaced persons as a result of conflicts and major disasters. And I also want to remind MEDEVAC program, under which the Czech Republic regularly sends to regions that are faced with large waves of migration, the medical teams to treat the sick refugees on the spot. We are the country that is inclusive, we are a country that helps, and I want to state clearly that we are also a country that will help. But our aim is to set up a system of support and assistance in such a way to solve the causes of migration, not only to respond to its consequences. Thus, it is not yet set our immigration policy in Europe and we want to talk about it, so in this way was primarily set the policy of the European Union.A number of questions that are heard, involved asylum policy. I would like to briefly on these rules now mention. Czech Republic as a member of the European Union is also committed to cooperation in the field of asylum and refugees and in accordance with these commitments, we have to deal with every asylum requests we receive. The Czech Republic as well as any other state of the European Union can select those whose requests will be considered. The obligation to provide international protection arises from Art. 43 of our Charter of Rights and Freedoms. However, the rules for granting national status of asylum seeker each state determines itself. The basic law in our country is the Asylum Act, the Act on temporary protection of foreigners. Czech Republic today is not the primary destination country for foreigners from third countries must not react to a possible increased waves of refugee flows into the Czech Republic.Immigration and asylum flows has important safety aspect. When the reception of refugees is placing emphasis on minimizing security risks with regard to the events of recent months, the Interior Ministry as a response to the deteriorating situation and as efforts to meet the Union's commitments submitted a draft decree implementing the Asylum Act and the Act on temporary protection of foreigners. The problem is that currently increasing the number of refugees applying for political asylum. Member States have limited capacity on the one hand and, secondly, the overall integration of these people is more difficult than the adoption of legal migrants who come to the destination country voluntarily for economic reasons. One of the objectives is to promote legal migration was economic migration, ie. Bring to the Czech Republic foreign experts who are able to contribute to the development of the economy. Here is our interest, and I must say that is part of the government to come to us mainly by people from countries that are culturally and religiously loved ones who have a chance at a good and seamless integration. Our priority in this area is to minimize illegal migration and to clearly distinguish persons who qualify for international protection. It is essential that these people who qualify for political asylum, separate from the purely economic migrants. Political refugees must have a chance not to be waited for our help. For economic migrants is always a possibility must be respected and the situation of individual countries. On economic migration, there are no guaranteed rights.Do not let me, therefore, to put the position of the Czech Republic, the measures that are proposed in response to the current migration situation. Czech Republic promotes geographical balance measures under migration. Also highlight the fact that it is necessary to solve the situation not only in the Mediterranean, but also in other crisis areas. It is impossible to forget the situation in Ukraine, which is economically significantly deteriorated in recent years, it can not forget the situation in the Western Balkans, where in some countries also feel relatively strong instability. Another key element of the strategic approach of the European Union must be effective management of external borders and the strengthening of protection. The current crisis situation realistically threatens the functioning of the Schengen area. There are ideas that promote a revision of Schengen. Czech Republic had their next steps to submit it to the free movement of persons within the European Union retained in full, because it is a key principle, which is also very positive perception of our community. Better functioning of the external borders, or better, at least some of the functioning of the external borders, because I think that the functioning of the external borders at the moment in Italy and Greece, largely collapsed, at least some of the functioning of the external borders by us in this direction should help considerably.I want to emphasize that the European Union can not function without a long-term, to be able to protect its borders. Unfortunately, in Greece and Italy, this protection is largely collapsed. Collapsed under the pressure of a campaign organized traffickers and collapsed under the pressure of destabilizing the countries that lie in close proximity to the European Union. Such a state border protection is a long-term functioning of the Schengen system, unacceptable and impossible. I think that if there is the fact that compliance with the rules in their entirety Schengen area, so that sooner or later may lead to the Schengen area collapses. What is important is also the European Union and individual countries to underestimate the criminal aspects of what we are experiencing. Criminal aspects, because there is very often on business. Therefore, it is important that there is enhanced cooperation between the police departments of justice in the individual countries in the fight against the traffickers against traffickers; those networks extend large part of Europe, not just the network organized in Libya, but they are also networks of organized nowadays in Italy or the western Balkans, and it is important that there existed a coordinated cooperation in the fight against those who have a migration made profitable very simple and profitable business.The European Union must review the current practice of return. Either return practice nonexistent, or is ineffective. Europe comes while many refugees whose asylum application is not motivated by an immediate need for protection, but access to the living standards and social benefits in some Member States. So, I say it is important that every state was able to regulate economic migration.Concerning the already mentioned resettlement or relocation mechanisms. As I mentioned, we insist that they remain voluntary. It is not a solution to the cause, but the consequence. Quotas can impress paradoxically an invitation to the EU and as an encouragement to organized crime smugglers. I am convinced that the problems of African and Middle Eastern countries simply can not deal with the fact that their population or their active elites they move, they move en masse to the European Union. In these countries, such exodus will inevitably lead to a further degradation, for further backwardness, which only spin migration spiral. The proposed quotas are therefore unsystematic step will not bring solutions migratory pressure, bring his distraction, although perhaps relieve some Member States, but this can only be an illusion, because when quotas are used for countries that are major objectives for migration, so these people they remain well and will be directed to countries that provide much greater social benefits. However creates unexpected pressure on the capacity of other Member States, including the Czech Republic.High and unexpected flow of migrants to Europe may also lead to increased antagonism by ethnic and religious keys. We must not forget that the proposed system of redistribution within the current common rules prevent, in any case, the fact that people who receive asylum on the basis of relocation, not directed to a completely other states than those in which the asylum was granted. Czech Republic is in any case does not waive their joint and several liability. I think it is evident from the list of measures that we have already done. We helped and we are willing to help on a voluntary basis, we are very well aware that we can not close our eyes to reality.We must reject the promotion of hatred against refugees, because they often can only be ammunition in an attempt to get on some political points, but at the same time you can not establish a redistributive system, which will bring even worse consequences.What may be the way forward? We believe that it is important to the EU debate back to a rational plane, it is necessary to balance the principle of solidarity and responsibility, the need to offer a credible alternative, not only to countries that at this moment are burdened by migratory flows, but also the countries that are today sources of these migratory waves. I also want to mention the fact that even on the basis of the changes that have taken place around Europe, and on the basis of the ongoing changes in our labor market, the government is preparing a new strategy for migration policy, and I expect that this strategy of migration policy will be widely discussed, as well as end ends was the strategy of foreign policy and security policy strategy.Dear Members of Parliament, Honourable Members, I want to assure you that the Government of the Czech Republic will be at the European Council to take a position which is in line with the recommendation of a parliamentary committee for European affairs. So how I could get acquainted with the draft resolution, which is ready for today's meeting the Chamber of Deputies, the government is prepared to move within the opinion of the Chamber of Deputies, if this proposal is approved. However, I want to point out that the next European Council meeting will undoubtedly important, but it certainly will not be the last European Council meeting, at which we have dealt with this issue. Therefore, I propose that the government remained Parliament in close contact, especially through the European Affairs Committee, which should discuss information on how to proceed government on this issue in relation to the proposals and rules of the European Union, and of course in the event for any significant change in the rules at the European level, so I'm ready to inform the Parliament and I am ready also inform about the steps that the government in response to a possible modification of the rules of the European Union chooses.So much for the report, which I presented at the request of the parliamentary parties, which initiated this meeting of the Chamber of Deputies. Thank you.
